blog.description: This blog has been abandoned. You ought to be able to find me by the same username on Dreamwidth, Pillowfort, Elysian Fields... uh, BuffyForums, AO3, LiveJournal, and it's also a gmail email address. I *am* keeping my account up for as long as I need it for commitments such as newslettering and event modding.

tags: the bottom of the second screenshot was that bit
summary: "Harry Potter and the Methods of Rationality" (2010-2015) by  Eliezer Yudkowsky left a profound impact on me some years ago,...
caption:
“Harry Potter and the Methods of Rationality” (2010-2015) by Eliezer Yudkowsky left a profound impact on me some years ago, mainly in ways unrelated to these screenshots. Today, one of the political bits kept nagging at me.

http://www.hpmor.com/chapter/35

tags: cauliflowers should change their horrible smell if they want to be eaten
so i don't know why i'm been mean to them
summary:
Draco: I'm not eating that
Harry: Why? I made it
Draco: That's reason number one. Reason number two is that it smells like shit,...
body:
Draco: I'm not eating that
Harry: Why? I made it
Draco: That's reason number one. Reason number two is that it smells like shit, and reason number three is that it looks awful
Harry: It's a cauliflower, it's supposed to smell bad!

dialogue.name: Draco
dialogue.label: Draco:
dialogue.phrase: That's reason number one. Reason number two is that it smells like shit, and reason number three is that it looks awful

dialogue.name: Harry
dialogue.label: Harry:
dialogue.phrase: It's a cauliflower, it's supposed to smell bad!

tags: fantastic beats and where to find them
fantastic beats the crimes of grindelwald
albus and merlin love one person all their life
body:
Order of Merlin

The Order of Merlin (abbreviated O.M.) was an award bestowed upon wizards and witches who had achieved great things for the wizarding world. 

Albus Dumbledore Awarded for his defeat of the dark wizard Gellert Grindelwald, effectively putting an end to the global wizarding war. (Wiki)

Friendly reminded: Albus is gay. He bested his lover and won O.M. It’s ironic that, poetic justice, because Merlin was gay too

Order of Merlin

blog.name: accio-shitpost
blog.title: shitpost managed
blog.description:
FAQ

unforgivably cursing you with our existence since 1965

as seen in Bo Burnham's Eighth Grade, apparently

we have a Discord server! join here! (15+ only please)

we track the tag 'accioshitpost' (without a dash) so if you have art or a fic based on of one of our posts, pop it in there and we'll reblog it for you! we always appreciate your creativity!

you can find our amazon wishlists here and here - if you get us anything, we'll post a picture and a thank you note!!

if you want to follow our personal blogs, here's Roxie's, here's Persephone's, and here's Jamie's

nazis, terfs, pedos, and anybody happy to defend or stand by them can leave. we don't want you. avada kedavra, shithead.

now in blue raspberry flavours, hitting stores soon!

tags: i wanted to write this in full
i have so many ideas for it
but it just got so long
thinking of making a full fic out of this
title: Dark Draco
body:
An AU where wands are passed down in pureblood families, when a child is born and once that child is old enough to attend wizarding school, they are explained the origins of the wand and the power it wields. Due to the ancient magic contained in these wands, they are kept hidden or regulated by The Ministry. 

As a baby, Draco receives his wand, which has adapted itself to suit the power of a child. He feels drawn to the wand, until he receives his hawthorn wand when leaving for Hogwarts. Lucius, distracted by the possible return of The Dark Lord, never explains to Draco the importance of the wand and the true power it holds. 

Draco attends Hogwarts, being sorted into Slytherin and still maintains his rivalry with The Golden Trio. However, by fourth year, Draco is struggling through understanding his sexuality and attraction to Harry. He cheers him on the trials, which goes unnoticed by Harry. 

Fifth year, Draco spends more time at Malfoy Manor, curious about the wand kept in a glass cabinet. He feels a pull towards it, and can feel it’s power taking hold of him just slightly. 

Sixth year, Draco is tasked with killing Dumbledore. Even with guidance from Snape, he can’t bring himself to do it, and instead becomes a double agent between the Death Eaters and The Order. He is still branded with the Dark Mark. Throughout this year, he develops a relationship with Harry. They confide in each other in the early hours of the morning at Grimmauld Place when The Order are hiding from Death Eaters. They never say, but they know their relationship runs deeper than they can understand. Draco asks Harry to return to him at the start of their seventh year. 

Harry doesn’t. He hunts for Horcruxes while Draco is forced to torture first years at Hogwarts. When the battle comes, Draco nearly collapses at the sight of Harry’s dead body in Hagrid’s arms. Harry comes back to fight Voldemort and Draco throws him his hawthorn wand which kills Voldemort. Expecting Harry to run to him, Draco waits. Instead, Harry runs to Ron and Hermione, and into the waiting embrace of Ginny. Draco crumples. He apparates to The Manor, alone. 

Draco watches for two years as Harry appears to have the perfect life. He becomes an auror, gets engaged to Ginny and lives a seemingly full life. The only time Draco sees Harry is at the trials, where he speaks on his and Narcissa’s behalf. Meanwhile, Draco, confined on probation to The Manor, wanders aimlessly. His father, dead in Azkaban, was the only thing keeping his family together. Without him, Narcissa becomes a shell of herself; she no longer speaks to Draco. The sounds that once filled The Manor are gone; the sound of Narcissa playing the piano and the clamour of house elves

He finds himself in a different room each day, feeling the pull of different dark objects yet to be removed. Each night, he returns to the room with the glass cabinet and the wand, no memory of how he got there. The longer he stays in the house, the more he feels a pull towards the wand. 

Narcissa dies alone. There is no ceremony, her body is left on the sofa where she watched a portrait of Lucius and herself.  In his grief and the threat of impending aurors, Draco flees, is only possession the ancient wand. 

Draco apparates to muggle London, the wand driving his actions. He is attacked by two muggles in an alleyway. Without thinking, he stupefies the two. When their bodies hit the pavement, the force of the stupify so hard the crack of their skull echoes. Draco had killed, without thinking. 

He enjoyed it. The feeling of being in control again, the power that came with the release of magic. 

Reports to the Ministry arrive of a rogue wizard stunning muggles to death. In vain, Aurors attempt to chase down Draco, but no one can track his sporadic kills. In his name, Dark Lord sympathizers kill and torture muggles, anticipating a return of another, more powerful dark wizard. 

Harry has been tracking Draco, as an escape from his engagement to Ginny and his new responsibilities to The Ministry. He remembers the thrill of chasing down Draco from his years at Hogwarts, in those moments it’s just him and Draco. 

One night, after a particularly bad fight with Ginny, Harry decides to go out onto the field and chase down Draco himself. He was sick of being locked up in The Ministry, everyone too scared to send him out on missions, afraid of losing their Chosen One. 

When they finally meet, it’s as though time stands still. Harry can see Draco fighting the power of the wand; Draco can see Harry fighting off people’s expectations. There’s no anger, no bitter hatred. They see each other. And they run. They run from the aurors chasing them. They run from the lives they once knew. And maybe they don’t even quite heal; become the full versions of themselves again. But they have each other now.

summary: what i read in september  This Charming Man https://archiveofourown.org/works/556294 • Harry doesn't understand how he's...
body:
what i read in september

This Charming Man

https://archiveofourown.org/works/556294

• Harry doesn’t understand how he’s supposed to learn the genteel art of pureblood etiquette from the rudest arsehole he’s ever known. •

as always this was pretty cute. good characterization which i’m always in to


Let Me Be Selfish With Your Body

https://archiveofourown.org/works/13491501

• When Blaise gifts Draco a sexual fantasy mirror for his birthday, Draco doesn’t think he’s actually going to use it.

It seems he didn’t take his own ridiculous obsession with Potter into account. •

oh mannn i love pining fics. and draco pines. boy does he. this is super hot but also really really sweet


Just Friends (Or Why Draco Malloy Shouldn’t Have Sex In His Office)

https://archiveofourown.org/works/10369206/chapters/22908243#main

• Harry and Draco are Auror partners, friends, and um… well, that’s it. Yes, Hermione, that is it. At least it is until Harry catches him doing a certain something that he can’t get out of his mind. •

more pining! and gay confusion! plus a good domestic about a chair

summary: RUMOR MÁGICO: 'Animales Fantásticos 3' podría trasladar la historia a un país de Latinoamérica
title: RUMOR MÁGICO: 'Animales Fantásticos 3' podría trasladar la historia a un país de Latinoamérica
body:
¡SAMBA!

A pocos días del estreno de la segunda parte, la creadora del universo de Harry Potter ha revelado detalles de la tercera propuesta.

Hace dos años, la primera película de Animales Fantásticos trasladó la acción desde Inglaterra a a la ciudad de Nueva York, mientras que la secuela, Los crímenes de Grindelwald, se desarrollará principalmente en París. 

Con tres películas más planificadas, es de suponer que los fans se pregunten qué otras ciudades visitará Newt Scamander y su valija llena de criaturas mágicas. ¡Y parece que ya podríamos saber cuál será la próxima!

El rumor llega desde la propia JK Rowling, que dejó entrever la posibilidad de que Animales Fantásticos 3 transcurra en… ¡Brasil!

Todo comenzó cuando, a principios de esta semana, Rowling actualizó su encabezado de Twitter para mostrar una foto de una calle concurrida. Y un fan tuiteó: “Jo, ¿podrías explicar el encabezado?” A lo que la autora respondió: “Es Rio da Janeiro en la década de 1930“.

Y otro fan respondió: “¡Dios mío! Nosotros los brasileños nos estamos volviendo locos ahora. ¿Estás preparando algo para nosotros?”

“Digamos que realmente debería poder deletrear Rio de Janeiro correctamente, dada la cantidad de veces que lo he escrito en los últimos meses”, concluyó Rowling.

It’s Rio da Janeiro in the 1930s. https://t.co/z7Begrrd9A

— J.K. Rowling (@jk_rowling) November 1, 2018

Let’s just say I really ought to be able to spell Rio de Janeiro properly, given how many times I´ve written/typed it in the last few months.

— J.K. Rowling (@jk_rowling) November 1, 2018

Es decir, si damos por hecho que lleva tiempo trabajando en el tercer guion de la saga (dado que, a diferencia de Harry Potter, ha decidido ser ella la que escriba los libretos), ¿estará insinuando que Animales Fantásticos 3 está ambientada en el Río de Janeiro de la década de 1930?

Sabiendo que las cinco películas de Animales Fantásticos abarcarán una trama que transcurre desde 1926 hasta 1945, cuando Dumbledore derrotó a Grindelwald, y el hecho de que las dos primeras películas se establecen en 1926 y 1927, tiene sentido que la tercera película tenga lugar en algún momento de los años treinta.

Por ahora, nos conformamos con la segunda parte, Animales Fantásticos: Los crímenes de Grindelwald (y la ciudad de París), que llega a la gran pantalla el 16 de noviembre.

Para seguir leyendo:
A Daniel Radcliffe ya no lo reconocen como Harry Potter
Animales Fantásticos 2 “SI” dejará claro que Dumbledore es gay
¡¿Cómo?! Rupert Grint revela el momento en que casi ABANDONA la saga de Harry Potter
Macaulay Culkin le pide a J.K. Rowling un papel en el universo de Harry Potter
Harry Potter: Unas cartas secretas de Alan Rickman revelan lo que de verdad sentía por Severus Snape
Los 22 estrenos que debes tener en cuenta para lo que queda de 2018

Imágenes: ©Instagram/@officialjkrowling/©Warner Bros.

blog.name: fixaidea
blog.title: Fixa Idea
blog.description:
Fixa's virtual scrapbook. Comics, illustrations and jolly randomness. And sword fighting, and other historical martial arts. Because whyever not?

While technically not a fandom blog, you may find liberal amounts of Discworld, Tolkien, Star Wars and Les Misérables-related posts, along with history, linguistics and anything else that happens to grab my attention.

summary: So the Black family is ancient and, despite their best efforts to keep themselves ‘pure’ probably pretty far-reaching. The...
body:
So the Black family is ancient and, despite their best efforts to keep themselves ‘pure’ probably pretty far-reaching. The combination of which just means there are a lot of relatives they Do Not Talk About. Now Sirius - he at least had the dubious honour to be put on the official family tree before being burned off, put there’s a particular relative even he Does Not Talk About.

The guy is not even a Squib, he just hates Wizards even more than Muggles, and by the gods, that’s a feat. Though at least he’s a very equal-opportunity misanthrope. Last time anyone tried to check he was running a bookshop mostly through sheer spite rather than successful sales.

He doesn’t outright loathe magic but he hardly ever bothers. Last time he used it was to fix a hole he managed to put into the roof of his shop trough very creative but entirely non-magical circumstances. In plain sight of the handful of costumers who still dare to enter despite being heavily discouraged in all possible ways. The Ministry worker sent to reprimand him got something vaguely book-shaped but visibly alive at him. Whether it was some dangerous magical item or a half-rotten book so dirty the bacteria on it built a civilisation, he never found out.

Tonks holds the title of the Only Tolerated Relative and that’s because she has a bottle of Firewhisky on her whenever she visits, and she doesn’t do it too often anyway.

Well.

These are so many words to say that magic is the only explanation as to how Bernard Black is not dead of liver failure yet.

@looney-unicorn

blog.description: generic teen dealing with generic shit

summary:
Okay so I got a question for my fellow PotterHeads.🤓
It was only in the fifth year that Harry was able to see the Thestrals cuz...
body:
Okay so I got a question for my fellow PotterHeads.🤓

It was only in the fifth year that Harry was able to see the Thestrals cuz he had seen Cedric die last year, and Thestrals are only visible to people who have seen someone die.

But Harry had seen someone die before Cedric. He had seen his mother die when he was a baby. So shouldn’t he have been able to see Thestrals right from the first year??🤔

trail.content:
Okay so I got a question for my fellow PotterHeads.🤓

It was only in the fifth year that Harry was able to see the Thestrals cuz he had seen Cedric die last year, and Thestrals are only visible to people who have seen someone die.

But Harry had seen someone die before Cedric. He had seen his mother die when he was a baby. So shouldn’t he have been able to see Thestrals right from the first year??🤔

summary: another snumbledore i did in spring i told myself i ididn’t ship them when i actually did  this pairing is very logical,cause...
caption:
another snumbledore i did in spring

i told myself i ididn’t ship them when i actually did 

this pairing is very logical,cause they spent a lot of time together, Dumbledore trusted Snape things he never trusted another person, and Snape killed him even everything in him was against it. also in the Snape’s memories he showed Harry a moment when Dumbledore saying about early sorting. it was compliment to Snape, to his bravery, he appreciated it and maybe it was only moment which was not about Lily and Harry in these memories, i think it means a lot
